page.title: 18HOUSING AND POPULATION
page.content: Most houses are detached and built of brick with tiled roofs. Almost without exception they have gardens. Many are very large. Nearly all families have a car and most have more than one. There has been little building recently. Very few houses are post war (1939). The population consists mainly of new- comers with a small nucleus of established families. Very few people are employed locally. Some work from home. Most commute to Guildford or London. Quite a number are retired. {LEISURE} Many enjoy gardening, walking, horse riding, tennis, badminton and swimming. Many families own dogs. Half the people surveyed have a creative hobby - music, art, carpentry. More than half go abroad at least once a year on holiday.
